fields.title: Create Your First Project
fields.description: Begin by creating a new project from your dashboard. Add a clear name, description, and define the main objectives so your team understands the purpose from day one.

fields.title: Add Tasks and Subtasks
fields.description: Break down your work into actionable steps. Add tasks, subtasks, and define due dates and priority to keep everything organized.

fields.title: Invite Team Members
fields.description: Invite teammates to your project and assign roles such as Admin, Editor, Commenter, or Viewer. Set precise permissions based on responsibility.

fields.title: Organize Your Workflow
fields.description: Use List view, Kanban boards, Calendar view, or Gantt charts depending on what suits your project methodology best.

fields.title: Set Up Automation Rules
fields.description: Reduce repetitive work by creating automation that assigns tasks, updates status, sends reminders, or triggers custom workflows.

fields.title: Track Project Progress
fields.description: Use dashboards, completion percentages, burndown charts, and milestone tracking to understand real-time progress.

fields.title: Collaborate and Communicate
fields.description: Use comments, mentions, file attachments, chat, and activity history to keep everyone in sync.

fields.title: Generate Reports
fields.description: Export detailed analytics, workload reports, time logs, and milestone summaries to share insights with your team.

fields.question: How do I create a new project?
fields.answer: To create a new project, navigate to your dashboard and click the 'New Project' button. Enter a title, description, deadlines, and optional metadata. Projects can later be customized with templates, tags, visibility settings, and workflow structures.

fields.question: How do I set project goals?
fields.answer: Open the project settings and scroll to the 'Goals & Objectives' section. Here, you can add measurable goals such as milestones, KPIs, deadlines, and expected outcomes. These goals will appear on project dashboards.

fields.question: How do I duplicate an existing project?
fields.answer: Select the project menu and click 'Duplicate'. You can choose to copy tasks, deadlines, assignees, files, or keep the duplicated project clean. This is useful for recurring workflows.

fields.title: Creating Your First Project
fields.description: Learn how to set up your first project, define goals, add structure, and customize workflows.

fields.title: Advanced Task Management
fields.description: Master dependencies, automations, subtasks, and advanced task-level settings.

fields.title: Live Chat Support
fields.description: Get real-time support for setting up projects, resolving issues, or optimizing workflows.

fields.title: Schedule Personal Demo
fields.description: Book a 1-on-1 call with a product expert to get a personalized walkthrough.
